channel.title: Computer Question
channel.description:
Alright so I have re-installed Windows (the plan is/was to re-install Windows after one year, every year for my computer to make sure it remains as fast as I can make it).
I'm having a bit of a problem with the keyboard and mouse functions. When I re-installed Windows for Samsung (and I have visited their website by the way, couldn't find anything that would help) I had to manually download all the drivers from their website based on the computer that I have or based on their model.
From what I know, I have downloaded all the up-to-date drivers and hope that I did at least but I have noticed that I can no longer click and have a key down (e.g. having the 'W' key down and trying to move the mouse) - this is a BIG problem while playing a MMORPG for example (SWTOR, Diablo III etc.)
So was wondering does anyone know what I should do? I might need to mention that it DOES work while I'm not using a game but will NOT work while I'm actually ON the game.
Here is the computer that I have by the way:
[url=http://www.samsung.com/us/computer/pcs/NP300E5A-A01UB?]http://www.samsung.com/us/computer/pcs/NP300E5A-A01UB?[/url]

item.title: Computer Question
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Thanks for the help, I have figured it out as well. When I called the Rep. for Samsung, she was telling me I should have used the built-in recovery system that Samsung has. I told her that the Rep. when I called two days prior didn’t tell me this and she apologized etc., the computer is NOW the way it use to be (as if I opened it up from the box) and EXACTLY with what it needs to be like and use.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Question
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

It will be somewhere in the synaptics settings. It was added as a deterrent to accidentally clicking while typing out that huge term paper.

Read full topic
